intro: Helianthemum cinereum subsp. hieronymi, commonly known as the rock rose, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a low-growing shrub with small, fleshy leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant thrives in rocky or well-drained soils and is often found in dry, sunny habitats. It is part of the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and drought tolerance. The subspecies hieronymi is distinguished by its specific geographic distribution and slightly different floral morphology compared to the main species.
